alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Knox; Pierce (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 10:26PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pierce, southeastern Knox and central Cedar Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1026 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Wausa, or 20 miles southwest of Hartington, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wausa around 1030 PM CDT. Hartington around 1055 PM CDT. Wynot around 1100 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Brooky Bottom, Obert, The Highway 84 and 15 Junction, Bow Valley, Magnet and Pleasant Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
